description: Remove one setback die while using non-attack Arcana spells.

Increase the base damage of your Attack spell by one per rank of this talent, to a maximum of five. This increase to damage does not stack with other effects that increase the base damage of the Attack spell, such as magical implements.
When using the alchemy skill with anything relating to Bloodoil, remove one setback die.
When using the alchemy skill with anything relating to Bonedustings, remove one setback die.
Do not add setback dice to combat checks due to the use of the Aim maneuver.
See talent pages in the core rule book.
See talent pages in the core rule book.
Make a Hard (3 Difficulty Dice) Divine check; upon success remove the immobilization status from your character.
See talent pages in the core rule book.
See talent pages in the core rule book.

Select a specific type of enemy, such as a spell caster from a government or an entire species. When encountering them in combat, remove one setback die once per encounter. Each rank selects another specific type of enemy.
Once per session, may perform a Familiar Sky maneuver; make a Hard (3 Difficulty Dice) a Knowledge check to reveal the current type of environment and other useful information.
Add one boost die to a spell casting skill check when your character is the first PC to act in the current encounter.
See talent pages in the core rule book.
See talent pages in the core rule book.
See talent pages in the core rule book.
Reduce critical by while using improvised weapons, while removing the automatic threat generated while using improvised weapons.
See talent pages in the core rule book.
See talent pages in the core rule book.

tags: Knowledge, Natural, Mortality, Systems, Paranormal, Mechanics
description: When acquired, choose 1 Knowledge skill. When making that skill check, may spend one triumph result to gain additional successes equal to ranks in Knowledge Specialization.
This replaces the Enchanting portion of the setting with being an adept machinist. Able to modify weapons and items through engineering. Swap out Alchemy with Mechanics when trying to enchant items.
While in disguise, ignore one setback die while making Deception checks.
Remove one setback die while interacting with a crowd while using Leadership. Each rank corrosponds to the group size table found on page 120. At rank 5, the difficulty is reduced by one.
Patients recover 1 additional wound per rank of Medical Specialist when they recover wounds from long term care.

Select a mundane trinket. An ally in a short range can be telepathically communicated to by the Divine or Arcana spellcaster as an incidental, so long as both characters are in possession of the trinket and the spell caster knows the character is present. Each additional rank “enchants” another mundane item.
While making Leadership or Coercion checks, characters making opposing skill checks add one setback die to their dice pool.
Your character is in harmony with magic. The character ignores the penalty for casting a spell while gagged, silenced or otherwise unable to speak.
sourcing: Source: Greatfrito's Genesys Magic Talents (Silent Casting)

description: Remove one setback die while disoriented until the start of your next turn
See talent pages in the core rule book.
See talent pages in the core rule book.
When making a Medicine check to help a character heal wounds, the target heals 1 additional strain per rank of Physician.
See talent pages in the core rule book.
See talent pages in the core rule book.
See talent pages in the core rule book.
See talent pages in the core rule book.
When healing strain after an encounter, heal 1 additional strain per rank of Rapid Recovery.
sourcing: Sources: ABGR, ACRB, ECRB, FBGR, FCRB
sourceBook: Sources: ABGR, ACRB, ECRB, FBGR, FCRB

description: When your character suffers a hit from a Ranged combat check, after damage is calculated but before soak is applied, your character may suffer 3 strain to use this talent to reduce the damage of the hit by two plus their ranks in Reflect. This talent can only be used once per hit, and your character needs to be wielding a Shield deemed appropriate by the GM.
See talent pages in the core rule book.

Once per session, when your character buys items they have a reduce cost of 10%. When your character sells items, they are sold at 10% higher. These prices are negotiated for the price prior to the 10% adjustment. This is done while buying from one specific merchant, shop or store once per session for every sell or purchase transaction while negotiating price with the merchant, shop or store.
When first acquired choose 1 skill; Charm, Coercion, Deception, or Negotiation. When making checks with that skill spend triumph to gain additional successes equal to ranks in Smooth Talker.
When using the alchemy skill with anything relating to Sparklebits, remove one setback die.

All spirits (ghosts, elementals, etc) are revealed to you the space you can see. You are able to speak to the spirits and understand the spirits clearly. Remove one setback die in social encounters with a spirit.

Your character is in accord with magic, being able to feel the magic. Your character ignores the penalties for casting a spell without at least having one free hand, and for wearing heavy armor or using a shield.
sourcing: Source: Greatfrito's Genesys Magic Talents (Still Casting)

description: See talent pages in the core rule book.
See talent pages in the core rule book.
See talent pages in the core rule book.
See talent pages in the core rule book.
Change every despair to a success, not greater than the rank of this talent during social interactions of using the skills Charm or Coercion.

Take Action Plan action, make a Hard (3 Difficulty Dice) Knowledge: Systems OR Leadership check to downgrade the ability of all attacks made against a target. The next attack against the target removes the effect.
Remove the automatic threat produced by practicing Alchemy.
Add 1 damage per rank of Barrage to 1 hit of successful attack while using Ranged (Heavy) or Gunnery skills at long or extreme range.
See talent pages in the core rule book.

Once per round, after making an arcana magic combat check but before resolving its effects, you may suffer two strain to add an advantage to the results. This advantage may only be used to help pay to activate the Blast, Destructive and Impact special qualities, or the Manipulative additional effect. You cannot use this talent if the magic combat check resulted in more than threats than advantages.
See talent pages in the core rule book.
When an NPC exceeds his strain threshold, may spend 1 Story Point to convince that NPC to perform a single task of choice instead.
Add one boost die per rank of Blooded to all checks to resist or recover from poisons, venoms, or toxins. Reduce duration of ongoing poisons by 1 round per rank of Blooded to a minimum of 1.

Once per round, perform the Body Guard maneuver to guard an engaged character. Suffer a number of strain no greater than ranks of Body Guard, then until the beginning of the next turn upgrade the difficulty of combat checks targeting the character by that number.
sourcing: Sources: ACRB, FIB, EBGR, ECRB, FBGR, FCRB
sourceBook: Sources: ACRB, FIB, EBGR, ECRB, FBGR, FCRB

description: Reduce any wielded weapon's Cumbersome quality and Encumbrance rating by a number equal to ranks in Burly to a minimum of 1.
Add one boost die per rank of Command when making Leadership checks. Affected targets add one boost die to Discipline checks for next 24 hours.
May decrease difficulty of Discipline checks to avoid fear by 1 per rank of Confidence, to a minimum of Easy (1 Difficulty Die).
Spend 1 Story Point to recover strain equal to Cunning rating.
See talent pages in the core rule book.
See talent pages in the core rule book.
Once per session, may make Deceptive Taunt action. Make opposed Deception check. If successful, one adversary must attack the character during adversary's next turn.
See talent pages in the core rule book.
After hitting with combat check, may spend two advantages to disorient target for number of rounds equal to ranks in Disorient.

Make a Distracting Behavior maneuver and suffer strain no greater than ranks in Cunning. Until the beginning of next turn, equal number of NPC's suffer threats on checks. Range increases with additional ranks.
See talent pages in the core rule book.
When making a ranged attack while engaged with an opponent, may suffer 2 strain to reduce the ranged modifier by 1.

Once per round, after making a primal magic combat check but before resolving its effects, you may suffer two strain to add an advantage to the results. This advantage may only be used to help pay to activate the Fire, Ice, or Lightning special qualities. This cannot be used if the magic combat check resulted in more threats than advantages, or does it deal with an element, death spirit or life spirits.
See talent pages in the core rule book.
When an adversary becomes engaged with the character, the character may force the adversary to make a fear check, with the difficulty equal to the character's ranks in Fearsome.
The character may use Agility instead of Brawn for Brawl and Melee (Light) checks.
Suffer 1 strain when making a Move maneuver to move to any location within short range.

Once per round, the character may perform the Grapple maneuver. Until the beginning of the character's next turn, enemies must spend two maneuvers instead of one maneuver to move from engaged range to short range of him.

tags: Primal, Arcana, Heal, Magic, Wounds, Combat
description: Once per encounter, after making a healing spell add one boost die to that spell. The next non healing spell the caster uses adds one setback die to that check. This remains active until a non-healing spell is used or the encounter is over.
See talent pages in the core rule book.
See talent pages in the core rule book.
After hitting with a melee attack, may spend a triumph to knock the target prone.
Once per session, may perform the Known Schematic maneuver; make a Hard (3 Difficulty Dice) Knowledge check. Success grants familiarity with a building or ship's design.
When an ally engaged with the character makes a successful Charm, Deception, or Negotiation check, the character adds an advantage per rank in Coercion to the ally's check.
See talent pages in the core rule book.
Replace all Knowledge: Paranormal checks while casting primal spells with Knowledge: Natural checks.

Once per round, when making a non-spell attack check you may choose modifiers from an attack spell effect and increase the difficulty of that check by the listed amounts. This combat check counts as both as the based skill check and magic check, and can use the threat and triumph results for either skills. Melee or Brawl skills cannot extend their range.
sourcing: Source: Greatfrito's Genesys Magic Talents (Imbue Weapon)

description: Add one boost die per rank of Physical Training to Athletics and Resilience checks.
Your character must have purchased the Quick Draw Talent to benefit from this talent. May use Quick Draw twice per round. This also allows you to reduce the prepare rating by 2 to a minimum of one.
Perform the Reconstruct the Scene action; make a Hard (3 Difficulty Dice) Perception check to identify the physical characteristics of person present at the scene within 24 hours.
See talent pages in the core rule book.
When using a magical attack with the Blast quality, spend one advantage to exclude one target that would be have been affected by the explosion, up to ranks in Selective Detonation.
Add one boost die to all Charm, Coercion, and Deception checks.
See talent pages in the core rule book.
Treat thrown weapons as if they had 1 greater range.
While making Melee checks, may inflict damage as strain instead of wounds. This does not ignore soak.
Replace all Knowledge: Natural checks while spell casting with Knowledge: Paranormal checks.

The character and each ally within short range may spend one advantage on their failed combat checks to inflict one strain on the target per rank of Suppressing Fire. Each character can only activate this effect once per round.
May add 1 additional hard point to a number of items equal to ranks in Tinkerer. Each item may only be modified once.
May Parry while unarmed. Reduce strain cost to Parry while unarmed by 1 (to a minimum of 1).
See talent pages in the core rule book.
Choose any 3 Knowledge skills. They permanently become career skills.
Choose any 2 non-magic skills. They permanently become career skills.
sourcing: Sources: ACRB, EBGR, ECRB, FBGR, FCRB
sourceBook: Sources: ACRB, EBGR, ECRB, FBGR, FCRB

description: Once per round while benefiting from cover, may make the Ambush maneuver. Add damage equal to Stealth skill to one hit of next successful combat check against a target within short range before the end of the turn.
See talent pages in the core rule book.
When wearing armor, Increase total soak value by 1.
After making a Mechanics or Alchemy check, may suffer strain up to ranks in Attention to Detail to convert that many successes to advantages.

Choose one magical item (implement or enchantment) your character owns when taking this talent. Your character becomes bonded to this implement, and no other person may use it. Your character may attempt to summon it by making a Hard (3 Difficulty Dice) Primal or Divine Skill check.
Your character, and allies within short range, add automatic advantage to combat checks they make while benefiting from cover.
See talent pages in the core rule book.
Your character must have purchased the Body Guard talent to benefit from this talent. Once per session, when an ally protected by the Body Guard maneuver suffers a hit, suffer the hit instead.

Once per round, before you make a magic check, you may perform a Channel Magical Energy maneuver. By performing this maneuver, you gain a boost die on your next magic check this turn while also upgrading the check once per rank of channeling.

Your character must have purchased the Confidence talent to benefit from this talent. May spend a on a fear check to steady the nerves of allies making the same fear check. If the character does so each ally within short range who makes the fear check adds automatic successes equal to the character's rank in confidence.

May suffer a number of strain to downgrade difficulty of Charm or Negotiation checks or upgrade difficulty when target by Charm or Negotiation checks, by an equal number Strain suffered this way cannot exceed ranks in Congenial.
May always use Vigilance when making checks to determine initiative.
Reduce the crit rating of improvised weapons by 2 (to a minimum of 1).
When a character inflicts a Critical Injury, the target also adds two setback dice to their next action.

tags: Combat, Melee (Light), Melee (Heavy), Melee, Brawl, Disarm
description: May spend triumph or two advantage with a successful Brawl or Melee check to disarm opponent.
Take the Disarming Smile action; succeed at an opposed Charm check against a target within short range to lower all defenses of a target by ranks in Disarming Smile until the end of the encounter.

When you take the Counterspell maneuver, all opponents within short range upgrade the difficulty of checks to cast spells one additional time (for a total of two times), until the end of your next turn. Only for Arcana and Divine spell casters.
See talent pages in the core rule book.
Suffer 2 strain to perform the Double or Nothing incidental to increase the difficulty of the next check by one. Then, after canceling opposing symbols, double the amount of remaining advantages
See talent pages in the core rule book.
Spend one triumph or three advantages generated on a missed melee or brawl attack to upgrade difficulty of opponent's next attack targeting character by ranks in Feint.
Add 1 damage per rank of Feral Strength to one hit of successful attacks made using Brawl or Melee skills.
See talent pages in the core rule book.
See talent pages in the core rule book.
Allies equal to ranks in Leadership in close range gain the benefits of the Gain the Advantage action.
Your character must have purchased the Freerunning talent to benefit from this talent. Suffer 4 strain when making a move maneuver to move to any location within medium range.
When making a Melee or Brawl check, suffer a number of strain to upgrade the attack an equal number of times. The strain suffered may not exceed ranks in Frenzied Attack.

tags: Ranged, Combat, Blast, Story Point, Item
description: See talent pages in the core rule book.
Whenever the character's animal companion makes a successful combat check against a target, it may forgo inflicting damage to upgrade the difficulty of the target's next check once instead.
Once per encounter, may spend a Story Point to recover 4 strain.
Immediately after being hit by an attack but before suffering damage, spend 1 Story Point to increase soak by ranks in Resilience.
See talent pages in the core rule book.
See talent pages in the core rule book.

May suffer a number of strain to downgrade difficulty of Coercion checks, or upgrade difficulty when targeted by Coercion checks, by an equal number. Strain suffered this way cannot exceed ranks in Intimidating.
Remove one setback die per rank of Iron Body from Coordination and Resilience checks. Reduce the critical rating of unarmed attacks by 1 per rank of Iron Body (to a minimum of 1).
See talent pages in the core rule book.
See talent pages in the core rule book.
May spend two advantages from a Coercion check or two threats from a foe's Discipline check; that target cannot perform a free maneuver during his next turn.
May upgrade difficulty of incoming Charm, Coercion, or Deception checks once per rank of Nobody's Fool.
See talent pages in the core rule book.

When you cast a spell that can be sustained through concentration on an ally, you can spend three advantages, a triumph, or one story point to have that spell last until the end of the encounter without your character having to use the concentrate maneuver.
Take Pin action; make an Opposed athletics check to immobilize an engaged opponent until the end of the character's next turn. Spend triumph to extend duration one round.
Take a Plausible Deniability action makes a Hard (3 Difficulty Dice) Coercion check to convince one bystander equal to your Willpower to depart quietly.
Add 1 damage per rank of Point Blank to damage of one hit of successful attack while using Ranged (Heavy) or Ranged (Light) skills at short range or engaged.
Increase Blast damage dealt by +1 per rank of Powerful Blast.
Once per round, may perform Precise Aim maneuver. Suffer a number of strain no greater than ranks in Precise Aim, then reduce target's melee and ranged defense by that number.
May spend 1 Story Point to disengage from engaged enemy as an out-of-turn incidental.
See talent pages in the core rule book.

Your character must have purchased the Reflect Talent to benefit from this talent. Your character may use reflect while wielding a melee weapon deemed appropriate by the GM. When reflecting a hit that generated despair or three threats may hit one target in medium range with the same damage as the initial hit, after original attack resolves.

May perform the Resourceful Refit action, make an Average (2 Difficulty Dice) Mechanics check to scavenge an old attachment to construct a new one, reducing its price by that of the dismantled attachment.
See talent pages in the core rule book.
Once per session, as a maneuver, may make a Hard (3 Difficulty Dice) Athletics check. On success, other PCs may take their turns immediately.
When making a Streetwise or Survival skill check to navigate, the character may use Intellect instead of Cunning.
Your character must have purchased the Stunning Blow talent to benefit from this talent. When dealing strain damage with Melee or Brawl checks, may spend triumph to stagger target for 1 round per t.
While engaged with one or more adversaries, may suffer 2 strain to move to short range as an incidental.
When an incoming social check generates two threats or one dispair, may suffer 1 strain as an incidental to inflict strain equal to ranks in Coercion on speaker.
When gambling win 10% more credits per rank of Up the Ante.

Once per encounter, perform a Valuable Facts action: make an Average (2 Difficulty Dice) Knowledge: Mortality, Knowledge: Natural, Knowledge: Paranormal or Knowledge: Systems check. If successful, add one triumph to one ally's skill check during the encounter.
Once per session spend a Story Point and your character may add the Deadly quality to a spell without increasing the difficulty.
Once per session, spend 2 strain to make a Primal or Divine skill check as a maneuver.
sourcing: Source: Greatfrito's Genesys Magic Talents (Quickened Spell)

description: Your character must have purchased the Armor Master talent to benefit from this talent. When wearing armor with a soak value of 2 or higher, increase defense by 1.
Your character must have purchased the Body Guard talent to benefit from this talent. Body Guard maneuver may protect a number of engaged characters up to ranks in Resilience.
See talent pages in the core rule book.
Once per session, may introduce a "fact" into the narrative as if a Story Point had been spent.
Take a Center of Being maneuver. Until the beginning of next turn, attacks against the character increase their critical rating by 1 per rank of Center of Being.
When an engaged ally suffers a hit, may use Parry or Reflect incidental against the hit.
Once per session, may take Commanding Presence action; make an opposed Cool vs. Discipline check to force target to leave the encounter.
See talent pages in the core rule book.

tags: Ranged, Ranged (Light), Ranged (Heavy), Gunnery, Melee, Melee (Light), Melee (Heavy)
description: When acquired, choose 1 combat skill. Add damage equal to ranks in that skill to one hit of successful attack made using that skill. May not choose the same skill more than once.
See talent pages in the core rule book.

Your character must have purchased the Reflect talent to benefit from this talent. After using Reflect, may spend 1 Story Point to perform Move maneuver as out-of-turn incidental to close distance with or engage opponent.

Once per encounter, take the Discredit action, make a Hard (3 Difficulty Dice) Deception check to upgrade the difficulty of one character's social checks once, plus once for every two advantages, until the end of the encounter.

Your character must have purchased the Distracting Behavior talent to benefit from this talent. The Distracting Behavior maneuver inflicts two threat on NPC's checks when NPC's target character's allies.
Once per session as an action, make a Hard (3 Difficulty Dice) Charm check. On a success, cannot be target of combat checks until the end of the encounter or until making a combat check.

Your character must have purchased the Double or Nothing talent to benefit from this talent. When performing the Double or Nothing incidental, after canceling opposing symbols, also double the amount of remaining successes.
See talent pages in the core rule book.
See talent pages in the core rule book.
Once per session as an incidental, suffer 2 strain to flip one GM Story Point to a Player Story Point.
See talent pages in the core rule book.

Once per session, make an opposed Deception vs Vigilance check with the difficulty downgraded a number of times equal to your ranks in deception to have a target NPC believe specific false intelligence.

Once per session, may take an Incite Rebellion action; make a Hard (3 Difficulty Dice) Coercion check to cause a number of beings up to ranks in Coercion to become rebellious until the end of the encounter.
See talent pages in the core rule book.
Once per session when an ally would suffer a Critical Injury, may take an It's Not That Bad action; make a Hard (3 Difficulty Dice) Medicine check to stop the ally from gaining the Critical Injury.

The character chooses one personal weapon or piece of armor per rank of Jury Rigged. He may increase the damage of the weapon by one; decrease the a cost on its Critical, or any single other effect by one to a minimum of one; or increase armor's ranged or melee defense by one. Alternatively, he can decrease the encumbrance of the item by two to a minimum of one. The bonus only applies so long as the character is using the item. If the item is ever lost or destroyed, the character may apply Jury Rigged to a new personal weapon or piece or armor.
The character may spend one Story Point to recover strain equal to his Willpower rating.
If the character has already acted this round, increase ranged defense by 1 per rank of moving target.

Whenever an enemy engaged with the character makes a combat check, after the attack is resolved, the character may spend dispair or three threats to stagger the attacker until the end of the attacker's next turn.
Add +1 damage to one hit of successful combat checks against disoriented targets per rank of Prey on the Weak.
When this character or an ally in short range takes cover, he increases soak against ranged attacks by 1 per rank of Prime Positions until he leaves that cover.
While benefiting from an Aim maneuver, despair from the character's Ranged (Heavy) and Ranged (Light) checks cannot cause attacks to hit allies engaged with the target.
Perform the Rain of Death maneuver to ignore the increased difficulty due to the Auto-fire quality of attacks made this turn.

Once per session, may take a Street Smarts action; make a Formidable (5 Difficulty Dice) Streetwise or Knowledge: Systems check to learn one vital clue from the GM. Reduce the difficulty once per rank of Raw Smarts.
sourcing: Sources: ACRB, EBGR, ECRB, FCRB (Street Smarts)

description: Your character must have purchased the Reflect Talent to benefit from this talent. If the user did not make a combat check during previous turn, may suffer 1 strain to use Reflect.
Once per session, when your character is targeted by an attack, you may cast Barrier as an out of turn incidental.
See talent pages in the core rule book.
Once per encounter choose a number of positive dice equal to ranks in Second Chances and reroll them.
Decrease the Critical Rating of a weapon by 1 (to a minimum of 1) against targets that have not yet acted this encounter.

Once per session, may take a Street Smarts action; make a Formidable (5 Difficulty Dice) Streetwise or Knowledge check to learn one vital clue from the GM. Reduce the difficulty once per rank of Street Smarts.
When assisting an ally with a Charm, Deception, Leadership, or Negotiation check, add automatic advantage per rank of Supporting Evidence.

Your character must have purchased the Armor Master talent to benefit from this talent. Once per round, when the character suffers a Critical Injury, he may suffer 3 strain to take the Armor Master incidental. If he does he reduces the Critical Injury result that he suffers by 10 per point of his soak, to a minimum of 1.
When targeted by combat check from within medium range, may spend a Story Point to upgrade the difficulty of the check a number of times equal to ranks in Coercion.
Your character must have purchased the Center of Being talent to benefit from this talent. Suffer 1 strain to perform Center of Being maneuver as an incidental.
See talent pages in the core rule book.
Once per session, spend triumph on a successful Ranged (Heavy) or Gunnery check to add the Breach 1 quality to the attack, or increase an existing Breach rating by 1.
See talent pages in the core rule book.
Perform an Intense Focus maneuver; suffer 1 strain and upgrade the ability of the next skill check once.
Once per round as an incidental spend 1 Story Point to ignore despair generated on a social check by the character or any ally in short range.
See talent pages in the core rule book.
Decrease the a cost to activate the Blast quality on any attack by 1 to a minimum of 1.
When buying or selling goods, may suffer 2 strain to sell for 25% more or buy for 25% less.
When making a Brawl check against an opponent, instead of dealing damage, may deal equivalent strain plus additional strain equal to ranks of Medicine (this ignores soak).
When your character fails a spell casting skill check that targets another character or NPC, may spend triumph or three advantages to immediately reroll the attempted spell with a new target.
See talent pages in the core rule book.
